div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONORABLE RICHARD LORD LOVELACE of Hurley.
div.p:
I Cannot want encouragement to present a Poeme to your Lordship, while you possesse so noble a breast, in which so many seedes of honour, to the example and glory of your Name obtain'd, before your yeares a happy maturity. This Comedy fortunate in the Scene, and one that may challenge a place in the first forme of the Authors compositions, most humbly addresseth it selfe to your honour, if it meete your
gracious acceptance, and that you repent not to be a Patron, your Lordshipps will onely crownes the imagination, and for ever by this favour oblige,

closer.signed: My Lord The most humble Services of your Honourer, IAMES SHIRLY.
